subject: Philosophy
title: Occam's Razor
description: Learn Occam's Razor in one minute.

hook.text: Two theories explain the same evidence. One is simple; the other is wildly complex. Which do you choose?

buildup.text: Occam's razor says: don't multiply explanations beyond necessity. The simpler theory is more likely correct.

discovery.text: William of Ockham proposed this in the fourteenth century. Science has relied on it ever since.

twist.text: But simplicity isn't proof. Sometimes reality is genuinely complicated. The simple answer can be wrong.

climax.text: Occam's razor is a heuristic ‚Äî a guide, not a law. It helps you start thinking, not finish.

punchline.text: Keep it simple ‚Äî but not simpler than the truth.

quiz.question: What does Occam's razor recommend?
options: Prefer the simplest explanation that fits the evidence
Always choose the most complex theory
